title: Why do a lot of disposable cameras take such good quality photos compared to most smartphone cameras? - Quora

Good question! Photographic film is generally superior to the smaller digital sensors. This is in terms of tonality, and the ability to retain highlight detail without blowing out into an ugly mess. Small sensors tend to render details more harshly than film. Small sensors are very good, given their size, there’s no doubt about that. But they are no match for a piece of photographic film the size of a 35mm frame.
